column4: ok this is weird, I have just ran .. sudo apt-get install samba    sudo apt-get install smbfs    and for some reason /etc/init.d/samba start   says command not found..
ps aux | grep samba says its not running.... how do I start/restart it??
try "service samba start" instead
- yea I tried that it said unrecognised service samba
uhm. are you quite sure it got installed
give it an "apt-cache policy samba"
yea that says samba installed etc etc candidate number etc
well at least it does return something :)
I wouldnt have to restart the computer would i?
oh, i see the "samba" init script has been removed in maverick
try starting "smbd" and "nmbd" instead
that looks to have started it tho thanks
NetBIOS service

i don't believe you can have ppa.launchpad.net enabled generally, you need a specific ppa repository. you can ignore that error, or if you want to make it go away you can remove the relevant entry from /etc/apt/sources.list or /etc/apt/sources.list.d/
ok
I cant find that url in either sources.list or in any of the files in sources.list.d/
i can't think of any other place
:S what would you recommend then?
are you grepping for "ppa.launchpad.net"?
ah i see, that repository is currently empty.
no idea, but it can't hurt removing it
